changelog.summary: Restructure FAQ: module_id + page_id + tags; remove embedded module.faq
Add all client-ui pages and update module names to English

platform.name: Moodivation
platform.description: Moodivation is an HR platform that measures and improves employee engagement, motivation, and satisfaction.

modules.name: Reports
modules.description: Analytics and reporting for engagement, experience, and exit surveys.

modules.name: Surveys
modules.description: Survey builder and management — create, schedule, and publish surveys.

modules.name: Survey (Participation)
modules.description: The survey-taking experience for employees — overview, questions, completion.

modules.name: Onboarding
modules.description: Manages the onboarding journey for new employees.

modules.name: People
modules.description: Employee list management and bulk import.

modules.name: Feedbacks
modules.description: Feedback reporting — view and analyze employee feedback submissions.

pages.name: Engagement Report
pages.description: Main engagement dashboard showing the overall engagement score and trends over time.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Reports → Engagement Report from the sidebar.
key_actions: Filter by department, role, or date range
Drill into a specific survey period
tips: A score below 60 is a signal to investigate further.
Use the date range filter to compare periods.

pages.name: Engagement Report Detail
pages.description: Detailed view of a specific engagement survey round — shows question-level results.
pages.how_to_access: Click on a survey period from the Engagement Report page.

pages.name: Comments
pages.description: Open-ended comment responses for a specific survey question.
pages.how_to_access: Click a comment icon on any question in the Engagement Report Detail page.
key_actions: Filter comments by sentiment or keyword
tips: Comments are anonymous — no individual is identifiable.

pages.name: Exit Survey Report
pages.description: Overview report for all exit survey responses — tracks why employees are leaving.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Reports → Exit Report from the sidebar.

pages.name: Exit Survey — Good Sides of Working
pages.description: Lists what departing employees say they appreciated about working at the company.
pages.how_to_access: From the Exit Survey Report, click the 'Good Sides' tab.

pages.name: Exit Survey — Reasons of Leaving
pages.description: Lists the primary reasons departing employees gave for leaving.
pages.how_to_access: From the Exit Survey Report, click the 'Reasons of Leaving' tab.

pages.name: Exit Survey — Employee List
pages.description: Shows the list of employees who completed the exit survey for a given period.
pages.how_to_access: Click on a period in the Exit Survey Report to see its employee list.

pages.name: Experience Reports
pages.description: Multi-dimensional employee experience overview covering key work-life dimensions.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Reports → Experience from the sidebar.
key_actions: Compare scores by team or role

pages.name: Experience Report Detail
pages.description: Detailed breakdown of a specific experience survey dimension.
pages.how_to_access: Click a dimension card on the Experience Reports page.

pages.name: New Survey
pages.description: Starting point for creating a new survey — choose type or start from scratch.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Surveys → New Survey, or click 'Create New Survey' button.
key_actions: Start from a template or blank

pages.name: Survey Templates
pages.description: Browse the library of pre-built survey templates.
pages.how_to_access: From New Survey, click 'Choose a Template'.
key_actions: Preview a template before using it

pages.name: Survey Builder — Details
pages.description: Step 1 of the survey builder: enter the survey name, description, and basic settings.
pages.how_to_access: Start a new survey and you land on this step automatically.

pages.name: Survey Builder — Questions
pages.description: Step 2: add, reorder, and edit questions for the survey.
pages.how_to_access: Complete Step 1 (Details) and click Next.
key_actions: Reorder questions via drag and drop
Set question type (scale, multiple choice, open-ended)
tips: Keep surveys under 10 questions for higher completion rates.

pages.name: Survey Builder — Participants & Schedule
pages.description: Step 3: select who receives the survey and when it runs.
pages.how_to_access: Complete Step 2 (Questions) and click Next.
key_actions: Select target audience (all employees, specific departments, roles)

pages.name: Survey Builder — Summary
pages.description: Step 4: final review before publishing the survey.
pages.how_to_access: Complete Step 3 and click Next.
key_actions: Go back to edit any step

pages.name: Survey Builder — Simulation
pages.description: Preview the survey exactly as employees will see it before publishing.
pages.how_to_access: From the Summary step, click 'Preview'.
key_actions: Walk through the survey as a test respondent
tips: Always simulate before publishing to catch any wording issues.

pages.name: Survey Overview
pages.description: Landing page shown to employees before starting a survey — shows survey info and estimated time.
pages.how_to_access: Employees receive a survey notification and click the link.

pages.name: Survey Questions
pages.description: The main survey-taking screen where employees answer questions one by one.
pages.how_to_access: Click 'Start' on the Survey Overview page.
tips: Employees can go back and change answers before submitting.

pages.name: Survey Complete
pages.description: Confirmation page shown after an employee successfully submits a survey.
pages.how_to_access: Automatically shown after submitting the last question.

pages.name: Onboarding Report
pages.description: Aggregate report showing onboarding completion rates and scores.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Reports → Onboarding from the sidebar.
key_actions: Filter by department or start date

pages.name: Onboarding Phases
pages.description: Overview of all onboarding phases and their configuration.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Onboarding → Phases from the sidebar.

pages.name: Onboarding Phase Detail
pages.description: Detailed view of a single onboarding phase — shows tasks, surveys, and completion status.
pages.how_to_access: Click on a phase from the Onboarding Phases page.

pages.name: Onboarding Employee List
pages.description: List of all employees currently in an onboarding program.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Onboarding → Employee List.

pages.name: New Employee List
pages.description: List of newly added employees who are about to start or have just started onboarding.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Onboarding → New Employee List.

pages.name: Onboarding Employee Detail
pages.description: Individual employee's onboarding progress — shows completed and pending tasks by phase.
pages.how_to_access: Click on an employee name in the Onboarding Employee List.

pages.name: People
pages.description: Complete employee directory — view, search, and manage all employees in the platform.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to People from the sidebar.
key_actions: Search employees by name or email

pages.name: People Import
pages.description: Bulk-import employees by uploading a CSV or Excel file.
pages.how_to_access: On the People page, click 'Import'.
tips: Use the provided template to avoid import errors.

pages.name: Feedbacks Report
pages.description: Report of all employee feedback submissions — structured and free-form responses.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Feedbacks from the sidebar.
key_actions: Filter feedback by date, department, or type
tips: Feedback is anonymous — responses cannot be traced back to individuals.

pages.name: Settings
pages.description: Platform-wide configuration including account info, notifications, and integrations.
pages.how_to_access: Navigate to Settings from the sidebar.

glossary.definition: A numeric score (0–100) representing the overall level of employee motivation and connection to the company.
Employee Net Promoter Score. Measures how likely employees are to recommend the company as a place to work. Range: -100 to +100.
Individual responses are hidden when participation is below the anonymity threshold (default: 5 respondents). This protects employee privacy.
A short, frequent survey (typically 1–5 questions) used to track employee sentiment in real-time.

anonymity_limit.description: Minimum number of respondents required before individual answers are shown in reports.

reporting_limit.description: Minimum number of responses required for statistical significance in reports.

agent_behavior.fallback_message: I'm sorry, I couldn't find an answer to that. Please contact your HR team for help.
agent_behavior.escalation_message: I recommend reaching out to your HR manager for this topic.
